name: outsystems-task
description: Deploy your Outsystems Applications with a Deployment Plan
author: Outsystems

inputs.name: outsystemsApplication
inputs.label: Application(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select one or more Outsystems applications to deploy. [Learn more.](https://github.com/OutSystems/vsts/wiki/Getting-Started)

inputs.name: outsystemsTagAndDeploy
inputs.label: Tag and Deploy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Should the task tag a version in the source environment, prior to deployment?

inputs.name: outsystemsDeployPlanChangeLog
inputs.label: Change Log
inputs.helpMarkDown: Change log of the version to be created and tagged.

inputs.name: outsystemsAutomaticVersioning
inputs.label: Automatic Versioning
inputs.helpMarkDown: Follow Outsystems application automatic versioning. Version format is supported as [Major].[Minor] (.[Revision]).

inputs.name: outsystemsAppVersionName
inputs.label: Application Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Outsystems Application Version. Supported format is [Major].[Minor] (.[Revision]). Consider taking advantage of VSTS variables like $(Release.ReleaseName) that you can define in General tab. Example: 0.0.$(rev:rr)

inputs.name: outsystemsSourceEnvironment
inputs.label: Source Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the source environment for this deployment.

inputs.name: outsystemsTargetEnvironment
inputs.label: Target Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the target environment for this deployment.

messages.OSAppVersionAlreadyExists: The version '%s' of application '%s' already exists. Insert a new version.
messages.OSFailureAppsNotModified: The appication '%s' was not modified. Maybe syncronizing your environments will do.
messages.OSFailureAppVersionNotFound: The version '%s' of application '%s' was not found.
messages.OSSuccessfulDeployment: The deployment plan execution ended with status '%s'
messages.OSUnabletoMonitorProgress: Unable to monitor deployment plan execution progress. Last known state: '%s'
messages.OSNotDetected: Outsystems Platform not detected (unable to reach endpoint)
